--- Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@...> wrote:
>  The chapter about JUnit is about 20 pages and describes how to write
> a test case, a suite and execute tests.  Nothing new if you have
> access to the documentation.

Indeed, I spoke poorly. I know JUnit well enough. It's the testing
methods and advice I'd love to read.

> What is more interesting about this book is the presentation of
> several testing methods (mock objects for ex.).  I think this book is
> worth reading but if you don't want to learn German (...) you will
> find plenty of other books written in a language you better
> understand.

Suggestions? Essentially all of the testing books I have ever read suck
or don't cover object-oriented code using test first.

Regards,

Rob
